description:
Inspired after watching a volleyball ace nicknamed "Little Giant" in action, small-statured Shouyou Hinata revives the volleyball club at his middle school. The newly-formed team even makes it to a tournament; however, their first match turns out to be their last when they are brutally squashed by the "King of the Court," Tobio Kageyama. Hinata vows to surpass Kageyama, and so after graduating from middle school, he joins Karasuno High School's volleyball team—only to find that his sworn rival, Kageyama, is now his teammate.

Thanks to his short height, Hinata struggles to find his role on the team, even with his superior jumping power. Surprisingly, Kageyama has his own problems that only Hinata can help with, and learning to work together appears to be the only way for the team to be successful. Based on Haruichi Furudate's popular shounen manga of the same name, Haikyuu!! is an exhilarating and emotional sports comedy following two determined athletes as they attempt to patch a heated rivalry in order to make their high school volleyball team the best in Japan.

[Written by MAL Rewrite]
synonyms: ไฮคิว!! คู่ตบฟ้าประทาน

node.description:
[Twitter](http://twitter.com/i/user/336690901)

Originating from [Doga Kobo](https://anilist.co/studio/95/).
__Hiromi Kikuta__ is a Japanese sound director, who works for the company Rakuonsha.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%B2%B8%E7%94%B0%E9%9A%86%E5%AE%8F)

Takahiro Kishida is an animator and renown character designer.

Kishida's designs are well received by animators and attract talent into shows easily. He is also praised for his shot composition skills and copies of his layouts are widely distributed in the industry as drawing reference. Nowadays he is mostly only credited for character design in the shows he participates in, but in reality he works as an animation director uncredited quite often. He rarely heavily corrects the key animator's cuts, strongly believing that the animators' distinctiveness should be noticeable.

Noted for his designs on shows like [Haikyuu](https://anilist.co/anime/20464/), [Serial Experiments Lain](https://anilist.co/anime/339/), [Madoka Magica](https://anilist.co/anime/9756/), [Baccano](https://anilist.co/anime/2251/) and more.
[Takaaki Chiba](https://anilist.co/staff/147856/)'s brother.

Furudate's first published work was King Kid (2008), which won an honorable mention on the 14th Jump Treasure Newcomer Manga Prize.
Up to date, their gender is unknown and it hasn't been revealed whether 'Haruichi Furudate' is a pen name or not. However, it's a ​popular belief among the Japanese fans that Haruichi Furudate is actually a woman.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/inokoriinosan) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/岸本卓)

Originally an employee at [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/).

__Alma Mater:__ Toyo University

__[Website](https://www.yukihayashi.net/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hayayu1231)__

__Introduction:__
Yuuki Hayashi is a Japanese composer and arranger affiliated with Legendoor, who used to be a rhythmic gymnast

__Biography:__
His history in music began in university when he started creating music pieces for rhythmic gymnasts as a hobby for 5000 yen a piece. When he started getting requests from other universities for his music, his interest in music producing grew. After graduation, he was taught music for 6 months by a rhythmic gymnastics music producer, and now, he handles music for various sports. He also arranges music for dance, athletic competitions, companies, independent movies and recently, TV dramas and anime.

(Source: MyAnimeList, edited)

Sukima Switch (スキマスイッチ?) is a Japanese jazz fusion duo consisting of core members Takuya Ōhashi (大橋卓弥 Ōhashi Takuya?), born May 9, 1978, and Shintarō Tokita (常田真太郎 Tokita Shintarō?), born February 25, 1978, formed in 2003. Formerly with BMG Japan (bought by SMEJ in early 2009), they signed with Sony Music Japan's Ariola Japan label in September 2009.

__Members:__
Tatsuya Mitsumura - vocals and guitar 
Daisuke Furumura - guitar
Shingo Sakakura - bass
Shotaro Tsushima - drums

A Japanese rock band that formed in 2004. The group made their major debut with the mini album "How Are You?" in November 2007, and they held their first concert at Tokyo's Nippon Budokan complex in March 2010.

Spyair (stylized as SPYAIR) is a Japanese rock band from Nagoya, Japan, formed in 2005. The band currently consists of Hidefumi "Ike" Ikeda (vocals, former), Yuji "UZ" Nakai (guitar, programming), Kenji "Momiken" Momiyama (bass guitar, leader) and Kenta Sasabe (drums). The band's name, SPYAIR, was determined in one shot by the members, which came from the word spyware, a type of computer virus.

[Website](https://tacica.jp/) Formed in April of 2005, tacica is a two piece rock band hailing from Sapporo. Members: [Shouichi Igari](https://anilist.co/staff/149251/Shouichi-Igari) - Vocals & Guitar Konishi Yuuta - Bass Sakai Toshihiko - Drums (left the band in 2014)

Hirata Tomohiro is an animator, character designer and director. Pre-'00s he was still mainly an animator and character designer, making his debut as a director in 2003 with [Peacemaker](https://anilist.co/anime/161/).

Married to [Atsuko Nakajima](https://anilist.co/staff/102141/).
